{{Infobox politician | name = Wael Abbas | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birthname = | birth_date = November 14, 1974 | birth_place = Egypt | website = http://misrdigital.blogspirit.com/ | notable role = blogger, writer and human rights activist }} '''Wael Abbas''' ({{lang-ar|ÙØ§Ø¦Ù Ø¹Ø¨Ø§Ø³}}, {{IPA-arz|ËwÃ¦ËÊel ÊÃ¦bËbÃ¦Ës|IPA}}) (born on November 14, 1974 in Egypt) is an internationally renowned [[Egypt]]ian journalist, blogger, and human rights activist<ref name="CNNNov29">[http://www.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/meast/11/29/youtube.activist/ YouTube shuts down Egyptian anti-torture activist's account] [[CNN]], November 29, 2007</ref> who blogs at Misr Digital (Egyptian Awareness).<ref name="ICFJ">[http://www.icfj.org/press/20070824.html Egyptian Blogger, Burmese Reporter Named 2007 Knight International Journalism Award Winners]. Press release, August 24, 2007</ref> He reported an incident of mob harassment of women, and broadcast several videos of police brutality. His actions led to the conviction of police for torture, but he has been harassed by the Egyptian government, and his accounts with [[YouTube]] and [[Yahoo]] were closed. YouTube has since restored his account and most of his videos. [[Facebook]] had deleted Wael's account but it has since been restored.<ref name="Mediavarlden">[http://www.medievarlden.se/Articletemplate.aspx?versionId=108624 Egyptisk bloggare avstÃ¤ngd frÃ¥n Facebook] 4 November 2008.</ref>
==Accounts shut down by YouTube and Yahoo== In September 2007, his YouTube account was shut down.<ref name=CNNNov29/> All the videos he had sent to YouTube were no longer available. They included videos of police brutality, voting irregularities and anti-government protests. About 12 or 13 were of violence in police stations.<ref name="ReutersNov27">[http://africa.reuters.com/wire/news/usnL27590430.html YouTube stops account of Egypt anti-torture activist] [[Reuters]], 27 November 2007</ref> He was shocked by YouTube's decision.<ref name=CNNNov29/>
Yahoo had shut down two of his email accounts, accusing him of being a spammer.<ref name=CNNNov29/>
Human rights groups said that YouTube was shutting down a useful source of info on abuses in Egypt just as the government was increasing its crackdown on independent and opposition journalists.<ref name=ReutersNov27/> Twelve Egyptian journalists had been jailed between September and November 2007.<ref name=ReutersNov27/> Elijah Zarwan thinks that it was unlikely YouTube was reacting to official government pressure.<ref name=ReutersNov27/>
YouTube initially restored his account but not his videos, and said that his account was blocked because he failed to provide sufficient context about the violence.<ref name="ReutersDec03">[http://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUSL0316580920071203?feedType=RSS&feedName=worldNews YouTube restores account of Egypt anti-torture blogger] [[Reuters]], December 3, 2007</ref> 187 of his videos were subsequently restored.<ref name="WashingtonPost">[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/12/16/AR2007121601559.html?hpid=opinionsbox1 Egypt's YouTube Democrats] [[Washington Post]] editorial, December 17, 2007</ref> Abbas has posted on his blog that Yahoo has restored his email account.<ref name="YoutubeHoax">[http://misrdigital.blogspirit.com/archive/2007/12/05/the-hoax-of-restoring-my-account-by-youtube.html Blog post by Wael Abbas] December 5, 2007</ref>
== Guest appearances == * Abbas was a guest panelist on [[The Doha Debates]]' episode broadcast on [[BBC World News]] on November 13 and 14, 2010. The motion was: This House would prefer money to free elections. Abbas was against the motion and he won the debate.<ref>http://www.thedohadebates.com/news/item.asp?n=11527</ref>
==Awards and honors==
In 2008, he [http://globalvoicesonline.org/2008/12/05/egypt-wael-abbas-refuses-to-meet-president-bush/ turned down] an invitation to meet with U.S. President George W. Bush.
Abbas was announced the winner of a journalism award by the [[International Center for Journalists]]<ref name=CNNNov29/> on August 24, 2007.<ref name=ICFJ/>
Won the Human Rights Watch's Hellman/Hammett Award 2008<ref>http://www.fanoos.com/society/wael_abbas.html</ref>
Was named Middle East Person of the Year 2007 by CNN
Was considered one of the Most Influential People in the year 2006 by BBC
Won the Egyptians Against Corruption Award 2005/2006
